The face created by these four lines forms the rectangular prism's base. Now add two circles to create the cylindrical holes: 1. Draw the first circle with a center at (0.1875, 0.1863) and a radius of 0.1156. 2. Draw the second circle with a center at (0.1875, 0.5637) and a radius of 0.1156. Step 3: Transforming the sketch into 3D Transform the 2D sketch into 3D using the euler angles (0, 0, 0) and translation vector (0, 0, 0). The default normal direction will be used for the transformation. Step 4: Extruding the sketch to create 3D model Extrude the sketch along the normal direction with a depth of 0.1453 units. This will form the first part of the final shape. Part 2: Construction of two cylinders with a flat top and bottom, positioned side by side Step 1: Creating the coordinate system Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters (rotation in degrees): Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0], Translation Vector: [0.0719, 0.0708, 0.0]. Step 3: Transforming the sketch into 3D Transform the 2D sketch into 3D using the given coordinate system and default transformation settings. Step 4: Extruding the sketch to create 3D model Extrude the two circles along the normal direction with a positive depth of 0.2217 units to form the second part of the final shape. Use the "JoinFeatureOperation" to merge the extruded bodies from part 1 and 2. Final Shape: A rectangular prism with two cylindrical holes on opposite sides with a flat top and bottom added to each cylindrical hole, positioned side by side.</description>
